items.title: Arrive Mactan-Cebu International
items.detail: Terminal 2 ‚Äî Immigration 20-30 min. Grab a Globe SIM at the arrivals hall (‚Ç±300 for 15GB/30 days).
items.directions: Exit arrivals, turn left past the taxi desk. V-hire to Moalboal ‚Ç±250/person from South Bus Terminal, or arrange private van ‚Ç±3,500.

items.title: Transfer to Moalboal
items.detail: 3-hour drive south through winding coastal roads. Stop at Carcar for lechon (‚Ç±150/plate).
items.directions: Ceres bus from South Bus Terminal: aircon ‚Ç±180, 3 hours. Tell the conductor 'Panagsama.' Trike from Moalboal town proper to Panagsama Beach ‚Ç±50.

items.title: Sardine Run Snorkeling
items.detail: Walk into the water from Panagsama Beach ‚Äî sardines are just 10 meters from shore. No boat needed. Rent mask/snorkel ‚Ç±150.
items.directions: Enter the water near the lifeguard station at Panagsama Beach. Drift south with the current. Best visibility in the afternoon.

items.title: Dinner at Pleasure Point
items.detail: Beachfront Filipino-fusion restaurant. Try the kinilaw (Filipino ceviche) and grilled squid. ‚Ç±400-600/person.
items.directions: Walk south along Panagsama Beach, 5 minutes past the dive shops. Look for the fairy lights on the terrace.

items.title: Kawasan Falls Canyoneering
items.detail: 4-hour canyon adventure: cliff jumps (3-15 meters), natural slides, and swimming through canyon pools. Ends at stunning Kawasan Falls. ‚Ç±2,500/person with operator.
items.directions: Canyoneering operator picks up from hotel at 5:30 AM. Starting point is in Canlaob, 45 min drive from Moalboal. Bring waterproof bag for phone.

items.title: Lunch at Kawasan Falls
items.detail: Grilled fish, rice, and mango shake at the falls base. Simple but delicious. ‚Ç±150-250/person.
items.directions: Covered eating areas right at the base of the first falls. Several stalls to choose from.

items.title: Turtle Watching ‚Äî Tongo Point
items.detail: Sea turtles feeding on seagrass in shallow water. Snorkel from shore ‚Äî no boat needed. ‚Ç±100 marine sanctuary fee.
items.directions: Trike from Panagsama ‚Ç±100 (10 min). Enter at the sanctuary entrance and follow the snorkel trail markers.

items.title: Dinner at The French Coffee Shop
items.detail: Unexpectedly great French-Filipino fusion in tiny Moalboal. Fantastic cr√®me br√ªl√©e. ‚Ç±300-500/person.
items.directions: On the main road in Panagsama, across from Savedra Dive Center. Small sign ‚Äî easy to miss.

items.title: Transfer to Cebu City
items.detail: 3-hour drive back north to Cebu City for ferry. Ceres bus ‚Ç±180 or private van ‚Ç±3,500.
items.directions: Catch the Ceres bus on the main road in Moalboal town. Air-con bus leaves every 30 min. Get off at South Bus Terminal, then Grab to pier.

items.title: Lechon at CNT Lechon
items.detail: Best lechon in Cebu ‚Äî crispy skin, juicy meat, no sauce needed. ‚Ç±200 for a generous plate.
items.directions: CNT Lechon on M.J. Cuenco Avenue. Any taxi driver knows it. Grab from pier is ‚Ç±80-120.

items.title: OceanJet Ferry to Bohol
items.detail: Fast ferry, 2 hours. Buy tickets at Pier 1 counter or pre-book at oceanjet.net. ‚Ç±800/person.
items.directions: Pier 1, Cebu City. Arrive 1 hour early for check-in. Bring snacks ‚Äî no food service on board.

items.title: Check in at Alona Beach
items.detail: Transfer from Tagbilaran port to Panglao/Alona Beach area. 30-min drive.
items.directions: Vans meet the ferry at Tagbilaran port. ‚Ç±150/person shared, ‚Ç±500 private to Alona Beach.

items.title: Chocolate Hills Viewpoint
items.detail: 1,268 limestone hills that turn brown in dry season. 214 steps to the observation deck in Carmen. ‚Ç±50 entrance.
items.directions: 1.5-hour drive from Alona Beach to Carmen. Hire a driver for the day (‚Ç±2,000-2,500 for full countryside tour). Leave early to beat the tour buses.

items.title: Philippine Tarsier Sanctuary
items.detail: World's smallest primates in their natural habitat at the Corella sanctuary. No flash, whisper only. ‚Ç±100 entrance.
items.directions: In Corella, between Tagbilaran and Carmen. Tell your driver to stop on the way back from Chocolate Hills.
items.changeNote: Moved from afternoon to morning slot ‚Äî tarsiers more active in cooler morning

items.title: Loboc River Cruise
items.detail: Floating lunch buffet on the Loboc River. Filipino food and live music. ‚Ç±550/person including lunch.
items.directions: Loboc River Cruise dock is in Loboc town, 30 min from Corella. Cruises depart at 11:30 AM and 1:30 PM.

items.title: Seafood at Alona Beach
items.detail: Pick your fish from the boats on the beach. Grilled prawns, squid, and lapu-lapu. ‚Ç±300-500/person.
items.directions: Walk the Alona Beach strip. Look for the seafood stalls with fresh catch displayed on ice.

items.title: Balicasag & Virgin Island
items.detail: Full-day island hopping. Balicasag marine sanctuary has incredible snorkeling with sea turtles and reef fish. Virgin Island has a vanishing sandbar.
items.directions: Bangka (outrigger boat) from Alona Beach. ‚Ç±3,000 for the boat (fits 4-6). Negotiate at the boatmen's area east end of Alona.
items.weatherNote: 30% chance of rain ‚Äî checking forecast. Backup: Hinagdanan Cave + Bohol Bee Farm.

items.title: Dinner at Bohol Bee Farm
items.detail: Organic farm-to-table restaurant overlooking the sea. Famous for their bee pollen salads and edible flower dishes. ‚Ç±400-600/person.
items.directions: In Dauis, 15 min drive from Alona Beach. Tell your trike driver 'Bee Farm' ‚Äî everyone knows it.

items.title: Ferry from Bohol to Siquijor
items.detail: GL Shipping or Montenegro ferry, 2 hours. ‚Ç±800/person. Runs daily at 8 AM.
items.directions: Tagbilaran port. Van from Alona Beach to port ‚Ç±150/person (30 min). Arrive 1 hour early.

items.title: Rent Motorcycle & Ride to Cambugahay
items.detail: Rent at the port area (‚Ç±350-500/day). The island is a perfect 72km loop ‚Äî impossible to get lost.
items.directions: Motorcycle rentals are right at Siquijor port. Ask for an automatic scooter. Helmet included. Gas up at the station near the port.

items.title: Cambugahay Falls
items.detail: Three-tiered turquoise waterfall with rope swings. The most beautiful falls in the Visayas. Free entrance, ‚Ç±20 parking.
items.directions: From Siquijor port, ride south toward Lazi (30 min). Well-signed on the main road. Park at the top and walk down 100 steps.

items.title: Paliton Beach Sunset
items.detail: Palm-lined beach with the best sunset on the island. Pack snacks ‚Äî no restaurants right on the beach.
items.directions: From Cambugahay, continue the loop west toward San Juan. Paliton Beach is signed on the main road. 20 min ride.

items.title: Dinner at Salamandas
items.detail: Beachfront restaurant in San Juan. Great Filipino food and cocktails. ‚Ç±300-500/person.
items.directions: On the main road in San Juan, past the Coco Grove resort. Look for the blue signage.

items.title: Enchanted Balete Tree
items.detail: 400-year-old giant fig tree with a fish spa pool at its base. Tiny doctor fish nibble your feet (‚Ç±10). Mystical and photogenic.
items.directions: On the main road between Lazi and Siquijor town. 15 min ride from San Juan. Open at dawn ‚Äî best time to visit before tour groups.

items.title: Tubod Marine Sanctuary Snorkeling
items.detail: Protected reef with excellent visibility. Sea turtles, clownfish, and soft corals. ‚Ç±50 sanctuary fee.
items.directions: Near San Juan. Enter from the beach at the sanctuary sign. Rent gear from nearby stalls ‚Ç±150.

items.title: Ferry to Dumaguete
items.detail: Montenegro Lines, 45 minutes. ‚Ç±200/person. Ferries run hourly from 6 AM to 5 PM.
items.directions: Return motorcycle to port rental. Montenegro or GL Shipping ‚Äî buy ticket at the counter, no pre-booking needed.

items.title: Lunch at Sans Rival Cakes
items.detail: Dumaguete institution since 1977. Famous silvanas (frozen buttercream cookies). ‚Ç±200-350/person for lunch.
items.directions: On San Jose Street in downtown Dumaguete. 10-min trike ride from the port (‚Ç±10-20).

items.title: Fly Home from Dumaguete
items.detail: Dumaguete-Sibulan Airport (DGT). Flights to Manila via Cebu Pacific or PAL.
items.directions: Airport is 15 min from downtown. Trike to airport ‚Ç±100. Small airport ‚Äî arrive 1.5 hours before domestic flights.

notifications.text: moved Tarsier Sanctuary to morning slot on Day 4
Day 5 weather update: 30% rain chance for island hopping. Backup plan ready.
USD/PHP rate updated: ‚Ç±56.20 (was ‚Ç±56.45). Budget tracker refreshed.
All 4 devices synced. Last update: 12 min ago.

changeLog.title: Tarsier Sanctuary
changeLog.reason: Better to visit in cooler morning ‚Äî tarsiers more active

changeLog.title: Loboc River Cruise
changeLog.detail: Added floating lunch cruise ‚Äî fits perfectly between Chocolate Hills and return

changeLog.title: Dinner restaurant
changeLog.reason: Organic farm-to-table with ocean views ‚Äî much better experience

changeLog.title: Oslob Whale Sharks
changeLog.reason: Ethically questionable ‚Äî replaced with more Moalboal sardine run time

changeLog.title: Island hopping boat
changeLog.detail: Found cheaper boat ‚Äî ‚Ç±3,000 instead of ‚Ç±3,500. Booked with Captain Jun.
